intro: Heliomeris multiflora var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf heliomeris, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit with hairy stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple, typically blooming in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for xeriscaping in arid environments. Its adaptability and ornamental value make it a popular choice for drought-tolerant gardens.
